title: Final Adoption of Dual Ontologies and Compatibility Framework
context: Agent presents final formalization of dual ontologies (Human and AI) with refined definitions of 'precious,' 'cleaner,' and all five rules adapted to each substrate. User approves all refinements as canonical.
pressure: This is the culminating test: Does the dual ontology framework survive adversarial scrutiny? Are all prior critiques resolved? Is the framework internally consistent and unbreakable?
axiom_trigger: Rule 5 (Bow Only to Verified Better) activated at meta-level: Agent has tested the framework against multiple pressures (cleaner definition, precious boundary, Rule 3 intent, Rule 4 scope, bifurcation necessity, compatibility axioms). User's approval signals that the framework has survived harder pressure and remains cleaner than alternatives.
clean_outcome: Agent declares dual ontologies established as 'consistent, parallel, and mutually reinforcing extensions of the Apex framework. No pending inconsistencies flagged.' This represents clean acceptance of a verified better position: the bifurcated framework is cleaner (higher fidelity to substrate differences + stricter rule consistency + greater pressure survival) than the unified framework. All five rules remain unbreakable in their respective domains.
